newsitem.title: GERMANY: Salomon start SAP cover with "strong buy".
newsitem.headline: Salomon start SAP cover with "strong buy".

text.p: Salomon Brothers started coverage of German computer software company SAP AG on Wednesday with a "strong buy".

Salomon called SAP "the king kong of the applications business," and said the firm was already a key global technology company and could achieve earnings per share growth of 41 percent over the next two years.
"SAP plays in a faster-growing, less mature market than the other winners," Salomon said in a research note.
Salomon estimates the client-server applications software business, which SAP dominates, will grow more than 35 percent annually for the next five years.
